intro: Petalostemon multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered petalostemon, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals that are often reflexed at the tips. Petalostemon multiflorus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
